Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 3.8 Å (effective pore diameter of 8 MR windows)

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Kinetic quantum sieving and chemical affinity quantum sieving

Other Information.Additional Info: Adsorption capacity of 3.3 mmol/g at 100 kPa and 77 K.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Kinetic quantum sieving and chemical affinity quantum sieving

Other Information.Additional Info: Adsorption capacity of 2.5 mmol/g at 100 kPa and 77 K.

Sieving Mechanism: Combined kinetic quantum sieving and chemical affinity quantum sieving

Experimental Validation.Method: Gas adsorption isotherms, dual-site Langmuir model fitting, IAST selectivity calculation, breakthrough simulation
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: D2/H2 kinetic selectivity of 4.6 at 7 kPa and 77 K; D2/H2 IAST selectivity of 3.0 at 100 kPa and 77 K.

Other Information.Additional Info: Na+ cations block access while K+ cations allow passage. The blocking effect increases with Na+ concentration.

Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 3.8 Å (effective pore diameter of 8 MR windows)

Other Information.Additional Info: Negligible uptake (< 0.1 mmol/g) at 100 kPa and 77 K.
Negligible uptake (< 0.1 mmol/g) at 100 kPa and 77 K.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Near zero adsorption uptake for both H2 and D2 at 77 K.

Other Information.Additional Info: Na+ cations fully block the adsorption of H2 and D2 at cryogenic temperatures.
